p: In Australia, climatically favourable areas for P. ramorum were confined to the temperate moist periphery, predominantly in New South Wales, Victoria, Tasmania and south-west Western Australia, with coastal areas of the south east of Queensland and South Australia also projected as being favourable ( Fig. 1). The pathogen was primarily restricted by hot, arid conditions in Australia (Supplementary Figs. S1 and S4). All of New Zealand was projected to have climates either moderate or highly favourable for P. ramorum, including the southern Alps, which extend above the tree-line ( Fig. 1).
